page.title: 14Public Houses in Weston
page.content:
Weston has 2 pubs, both owned by Halls Brewery. Both were built circa 1500 and are interesting examples of local vernacular architecture. Stone built with low beamed ceilings the Ben Jonson and the Chequers (which is thatched) exude the atmosphere of the traditional English country pub.
The Ben Jonson has 2 bars and serves traditional ales and pub food. Most of its patrons are local people and include the Haywain Club and Weston Football team. Darts, Pool and Aunt Sally are popular games in the pub.
The Chequers has 2 bars and a beer garden. It serves food and traditional ales to a mainly passing trade. A family room is available for over- night visitors. Pool and darts are played in the public bar.
